Participants.evidence: A single-case analysis was conducted in a 65-year-old male patient with severe respiratory failure.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention involved advancing the drainage cannula tip into the superior vena cava (SVC) and crossing the reinfusion cannula in the right atrium (RA).

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the efficacy of the F(SVC)–J(RA) configuration in veno-venous extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (V–V ECMO) for improving systemic oxygenation in patients with severe respiratory failure.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the partial pressure of arterial oxygen (PaO2), measured over the course of ECMO treatment.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The patient demonstrated a PaO2 far above 200 mmHg despite near-absence of ventilation under lung rest settings.

Harms.evidence: The recirculation ratio was calculated at 20.0%, and no right-to-left shunt was detected.
